meanings.definition: to admire, revere, or love greatly
meanings.sent1: She was idolising her favorite singer, hanging posters of him in her room.
meanings.sent2: The young girl was idolising her mother, wanting to be just like her when she grew up.
meanings.sent3: He was idolising his pet goldfish, even giving it a tiny crown to wear.
meanings.sent4: The little boy was idolising his toy superhero, believing it could protect him from monsters.
meanings.sent5: The artist was idolising the beauty of nature, capturing it in every brushstroke.

meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people were idolising multiple gods, each representing different aspects of life.
meanings.sent2: The tribe was idolising the sun god, offering prayers for a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The child was idolising his favorite toy, pretending it was a powerful deity.
meanings.sent4: The villagers were idolising the mysterious statue, believing it to be a divine being.
meanings.sent5: The civilization was idolising the river, attributing its life-giving properties to a higher power.

meanings.definition: to treat with excessive admiration or devotion
meanings.sent1: She was idolising her new celebrity crush, following his every move on social media.
meanings.sent2: The fans were idolising the famous actor, camping outside the theater for a chance to see him.
meanings.sent3: He was idolising his vintage car, spending hours polishing it to perfection.
meanings.sent4: The group was idolising their charismatic leader, hanging on to his every word.
meanings.sent5: The student was idolising the brilliant scientist, dreaming of one day working alongside him.
